sent_question: he enjoys walking in the woods alone?
not all of the students were tired?
he did not love the movie?
the cookie was not both chocolate and oatmeal?
the weekends were not always sunny?
two but not three of the players were skillful?
sent_manipulation: John spends a lot of time with his family.
Bob cares about his students and keeps in touch with them.
John is an avid shopper and likes dressing up.
Bob has never been to the bakery before.
John doesn't usually pay attention to the weather.
John has only seen one or two football games.
sent_context: John and Bob were talking about sailing yesterday.
John and Bob were talking about restaurants yesterday.
A year ago, Bob and John were talking about the students in a class they taught.
Last month, Bob and John were talking about a shirt at a local store.
Yesterday, John and Bob were talking about a movie at the local theater.
A few days ago, John and Bob were talking about a particular kind of cookie at a local bakery.
Bob and John were talking about the weather during the previous month.
Last week, John and Bob were talking about the football game.
expt_aim: To see how context of a word affects how we perceive its meaning.
sent_inference: I enjoy going sailing with my father.
I don't like eating out at upscale places.
Some of the students were tired.
The cookie was chocolate or oatmeal.
Two of the players were skillful.

expt_gen: Good luck with the linguistic research, y'all.
character_thoughts: They are a bit strange...just the kinds of guys I'd like to get to know!
